part3.question: Why do people choose to visit galleries and museums in person instead of viewing art online?
part3.model_answer: Opinion From my perspective [视角], it can make us physically inactive but mentally active. Reason We rely on Automation [自动化] for chores, yet we process more information daily than ever before. Example While robots clean our floors, we use that time to learn Digital literacy [数字素养] online efficiently. Thus, we are shifting our energy, not losing it entirely.

part3.question: Should galleries and museums be free of charge to the public?

part3.question: Why do some people find life inspiration from visiting these places?

part3.question: Why do most children draw more often than adults do?
part3.model_answer: Opinion I am convinced that AI will assist but never replace human teachers completely. Reason Students need emotional support and moral Guidance [指导] that machines simply cannot provide. Example Even if AI has superior Algorithms [算法], it lacks the empathy to understand a student's feelings. Education is about human connection, not just facts and data.

part3.question: Is art education in schools as important as science or mathematics?
part3.model_answer: Opinion Generally speaking, it offers flexibility and access to vast resources globally. Reason Students can learn at their own pace using Innovation [创新] in education technology. Example Since materials are available on Platform [平台] apps, we can study anywhere and anytime effectively without stress. This makes education accessible to people in remote areas too.

part3.question: How does engaging in artistic activities contribute to the cognitive development of a society?
